project.name: POI Build
project.description: The Apache POI project Ant build.

property.name: jdk.version.class
property.description: JDK version of generated class files

target.name: help
target.description: Prints Apache POI's Ant usage help
target.echo: This is POI ${version.id} Java Version ${ant.java.version}/${java.version} Timestamp ${DSTAMP} The main targets of interest are: - clean Erase all build work products (ie. everything in the build directory) - compile Compile all files from main, ooxml and scratchpad - test Run all unit tests from main, ooxml and scratchpad - jar Produce jar files - assemble Produce the zipped distribution files - site Generate all documentation (Requires Apache Forrest) - dist Create a distribution (Requires Apache Forrest)

target.name: init
target.description: Initialization run before other targets.

echo.message: Using Ant: ${ant.version} from ${ant.home}, Ant detected Java ${ant.java.version} (may be different than actual Java sometimes...)
Building Apache POI version ${version.id} and RC: ${release.rc}

target.name: clean
target.description: Remove generated artefacts

target.name: fetch-jars
target.description: Fetches needed JAR files from the Internet

target.name: compile-ooxml-xsds
target.description: Unpacks the OOXML xsd files, and compiles them into XmlBeans

target.name: compile
target.description: Compiles the POI main classes, scratchpad and examples

target.name: retest-ooxml
target.description: run ooxml tests with poi-ooxml-lite

target.name: compile-version
target.description: Compiles the version class

target.name: test
target.description: Tests main, scratchpad and ooxml

target.name: test-all
target.description: Tests main, scratchpad, ooxml, ooxml-lite, and coveragereport

target.name: testcoveragereport
target.description: create test-report

target.name: test-main
target.description: tests POI classes that deal with the Microsoft Office binary (BIFF8) file formats (excludes OOXML)

echo.message: Published results from tests at build/report/index.html
Please use -Dtestcase=org.your.testcase to run a single test

target.name: test-scratchpad
target.description: test non-OOXML scratchpad classes

target.name: test-ooxml
target.description: test OOXML classes

echo.message: Checking if documentation recreation is necessary, i.e. if any file at ${main.documentation} is newer than ${build.site}/index.html

target.name: -check-forrest-installed
target.echo: Please install Apache Forrest (see <https://forrest.apache.org/index.html>) and set the FORREST_HOME environment variable!

target.name: docs
target.description: Builds the POI website

target.name: -forrest-docs
target.description: Builds the HTML pages of the POI website

target.name: javadocs
target.description: Generates the API documentation

javadoc.author: true
javadoc.bottom: Copyright ${tstamp.year} The Apache Software Foundation or its licensors, as applicable.

group.title: XSSF - Open Office XML Spreadsheet Format
XSLF - Open Office XML Slideshow Format
XWPF - Open Office XML Word Processor Format
XDGF - Open Office XML Diagram Format

target.name: maven-poms
target.description: Builds the POM files for a maven distribution, and copies these and the jars to the appropriate locations
target.echo: Use ant dist-nexus to deploy the artifacts in the remote repository

target.name: jar
target.description: Creates jar files for distribution

target.name: jar-javadocs
target.description: JavaDocs for Maven

target.name: assemble
target.description: Produce the zipped distribution files

fileset.excludes: build/**, dist*/**, lib/**, bin/**, out/**, tmp/**, sonar/**/target/**, sonar/*/src/**, compile-lib/**, ooxml-lib/**, ooxml-testlib/**, scripts/**, TEST*, *.ipr, *.iml, *.iws, *.lnk, *.rdf, *.swp, *.launch, *.log, .gradle/**, .idea/**, .settings/**, .classpath, .settings/**, .project

target.echo: Use "ant dist-checksum" to create sha256/sha512 checksums and GPG signatures

target.name: dist
target.depends: clean, compile, test-all, rat-check, forbidden-apis-check, docs, jar, release-notes, assemble
target.description: Creates the entire distribution into build/dist, from scratch

target.name: jenkins
target.depends: replaceVersion, compile, test-all, jar, javadocs, assemble, findbugs, release-notes, rat-check, forbidden-apis-check, help, fetch-svn-jars, maven-poms, maventask, mvn-install
target.description: Target run by Jenkins on a continuous basis. Builds and tests POI, generates artifacts and documentation, and searches for problems.

target.name: mvn-install
target.description: Install POI artifacts into the local repository. Equivalent of 'mvn install'

target.name: rat-check
target.description: Runs the Apache Creadur Rat check against the source code, to spot any files which are missing the correct license headers

replaceregexp.match: \s+Printing headers for files without AL header.++

target.name: findbugs
target.echo: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <Configuration status="WARN"> <Appenders> <Console name="Console" target="SYSTEM_OUT"> <PatternLayout pattern="%d{HH:mm:ss.SSS} [%t] %-5level %logger{36} - %msg%n"/> </Console> </Appenders> <Loggers> <Root level="error"> <AppenderRef ref="Console"/> </Root> </Loggers> </Configuration>

target.name: dist-nexus
target.description: upload build artifacts to nexus

fail.message: Environment needs to point to Java 8+

target.name: release-prep0
target.description: check to make sure the release tag doesn't exist yet

fail.message: Unable to connect to SVN repo. Verify apache-id username and password. If these are correct, change the release-prep0 target to check over http, which would indicate a problem with your https setup.
Cannot create release tag. https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/poi/tags/${RELEASE_TAG} already exists. Verify the requested release version (${version.id}).

target.name: release-prep1
target.description: update the documentation and create the svn tag - needs Java7+

exec.command: svn ci --username ${settings.apache-id.username} --password ${settings.apache-id.password} -m 'release prepare for ${version.id} - updating build.xml and changes.xml' build.xml src/documentation/content/xdocs/changes.xml
svn ci --username ${settings.apache-id.username} --password ${settings.apache-id.password} -m 'release prepare for ${version.id} - pin documentation' src
svn ci --username ${settings.apache-id.username} --password ${settings.apache-id.password} -m 'prepare for ${rel_next}' build.xml sonar src

target.name: release-prep2
target.description: compile the freshly checked out svn tag and upload it to the nexus - needs a JDK6

fail.message: Environment needs to point to a Java 8 JDK

target.name: release-prep3
target.description: write the dist to the release candidate repo - needs Java7+

target.name: release-finish
target.description: write the dist to the release candidate repo - needs Java7+

target.name: update-download
target.echo:
${rel_date} - POI ${version.id} available

The Apache POI team is pleased to announce the release of ${version.id}. Featured are a handful of new areas of functionality and numerous bug fixes.

A summary of changes is available in the Release Notes. A full list of changes is available in the change log. People interested should also follow the dev list to track progress.

The POI source release as well as the pre-built binary deployment packages are listed below. Pre-built versions of all POI components are available in the central Maven repository under Group ID "org.apache.poi" and Version "${version.id}".

Binary Distribution
    ${li1} ${li2}
Source Distribution
    ${li3} ${li4}

target.name: test-env
target.description: tests if ant is available on the jenkins worker

target.name: replaceVersion
target.description: Apply the version from build.xml in all other places
